Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/22/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (e) A record of any convictions other than
minor traffic violations from either of the
following:
• (i) The Michigan state police, tribal
police, or the equivalent state or
Canadian provincial law
enforcement agency where the
person usually resides.
One of ten employee files reviewed did not document a criminal background
check.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
• (3) An agency shall provide the licensee an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A

renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the
license.
One of three foster home files reviewed documented that the renewal application
was sent to the foster parent less than sixty days before the expiration of the
license.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not document that the foster parent
received the name of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Uploading Documents: Technical assistance was provided regarding the
timely uploading of documents. There were several incidents of documents
that were not uploaded and the consultant needed to request the documents
which were completed but not uploaded. The agency was informed that
documents need to be uploaded and ready for audit reviews.
• Audit Review Changes. The agency was informed that as of October 1,
2024, DCWL will no longer be auditing compliance with policy. Specifically,
FTM's, medical passport, safety assessments during in home visits, and the
thirty day time frame for PATP signatures will no longer come under the
review of DCWL.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incidents reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows: The agency was cited
for the following rule and policy violations during the Interim inspection completed
on January 12, 2024. The agency was cited for R 400.12510 (2) Independent
living agreement, R 400.12418, (2) (b) Development of service plans, FOM 722-
08D Treatment Plans, FOM 801-03 Medical passport, and FOM 722-06B Family
Team Meeting. The current Renewal Inspection did not establish any repeat
violations indicating that the agency Interim CAP was successful in preventing
repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was submitted and reviewed.
The assessment reported that the agency had reviewed their 2024 Interim CAP
compliance as well as the Monthly Management Report (MMR). The assessment
noted that compliance to the rules and policy had increased throughout the year.
The assessment noted that staffing issues were a barrier to compliance as newer
workers struggled with time management. The assessment also noted that due to
staffing shortages supervisors at times carried cases. In addition to this it was also
noted that filling vacancies is problematic in rural areas such as Gaylord and
Otsego County.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted a budget which was reviewed, and no concerns were
noted. The agency also submitted a certified public accountant annual audit dated
12/31/23 and no concerns were established.
Staff Interviews
Staff reported liking working for the agency and they feel supported by their
supervisors and the agency administration. Staff reported that at times there is a
shortage of worker’s, but the team pulls together to support one another.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern and well maintained facility in Gaylord. There is
sufficient office space for staff and visitation for parents. CHRI documents were
observed to be secured appropriately
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified four safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are
as follows:

Safety Alert #1. The safety alert was generated on 10/08/24 as the bedroom in the
basement is lacking floor to ceiling walls and there is a pass through window in one of
the walls.
Resolution: The agency initiated a special evaluation to address the concern. The
foster family has requested a variance, and a privacy curtain was installed over a
pass through window. Resolution was obtained on 10/16/14.
Safety Alert #2. The safety alert was generated on 10/14/24 as there was no smoke
alarm between the children’s bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 10/17/245 as two smoke alarms were
installed and photos provided.
Safety Alert #3. The safety alert was generated on 10/14/24 as a smoke alarm was
missing between the child’s bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 10/17/24. A smoke alarm was installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert #4. A safety alert was generated on 10/15/24 as the home was lacking a
carbon monoxide detector and no smoke alarm between children's bedrooms and the
rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 10/17/24 as a smoke alarm was installed
and also a carbon monoxide detector and photos provided.
Safety Alert #5. The safety alert was generated on 10/8/2024 as there is not floor to
ceiling finished walls and there is not a finished, painted ceiling.
Resolution: An approved variance was submitted to DCWL on 10/10/24. FIG grant
money to be submitted for installing the bedroom ceiling. The home will install a drop
down ceiling upon financial assistance being obtained and it is anticipated the ceiling
will be installed by 1/12/25.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
